properties.description: Eternity replaces wedding planners. With our digital CRM, we make wedding management easy for businesses and couples worldwide - allowing everyone to do what they love (no pun intended) without burning out.
properties.how_does_your_company_use_innovation__th:
We're finding novel solutions to century-old problems and improving traditional processes through out collaborative CRM - a business and client portal. We continuously aim to automate the predictable and humanise the exceptional with our technology.

Our business model combines SaaS with integrated FinTech payment processing - capturing and scaling efficiently - without being affected by wedding seasonality.
properties.how_does_your_product_contribute_to_a_he:
Ask anyone who is getting married - wedding planning is miserable. Over 64% of individuals choose to get married. That's over 5bn unhappy individuals planning "the happiest day of their lives". 

It takes a massive impact on our mental health, relationships and wellbeing - but is constantly overlooked.

Our product is a solution for the individuals, and the businesses that they communicate with. 

Bye-bye boring spreadsheets, hello Eternity.
properties.name: Eternity
properties.please_expand: We have the product, we need the right positioning and marketing to grow. Flight has proven expertise in elevating vertical tech platforms like Until & Zoe. Our niche business market impacts millions of people everyday, and we want to work with Flight to make a real impact.
properties.what_best_describes_your_stage_of_busine: I have a business that I want to scale
properties.what_is_your_usp__what_makes_you_differe:
Run by Gen-Z, for Gen-Z. We have a two-sided collaborative portal which is built for the vertical or wedding & events - allowing businesses and couples to interact, build relationships, and create magic in real time. We aren't just any random CRM that your business gets boxed into.

We also have partnerships and networks with some of the best brands - giving us a greater moat.
properties.where_is_your_business_based_: UK but wanting to scale to US

structured_data.executive_summary: Eternity is a digital platform powering the online infrastructure and enabling digital payments for the wedding and events industry. It provides an all-in-one, purpose-built, vertical-specific small business CRM SaaS solution to digitize the old-fashioned wedding and events industry.
structured_data.problem_statement: The wedding and events industry is broken and operates like it's 1998. Businesses in this industry face fragmented systems and processes, using multiple tools for lead capture, nurturing, booking, collaboration, and closing deals. This includes wedding directories, social media, word of mouth, websites, brochures, meeting bookings, proposals, quotes, invoices, contracts, itineraries, payment reminders, design notes, and reviews - alongside multiple tabs and Excel spreadsheets.
structured_data.solution: Eternity offers an all-in-one integrated solution from lead capture to close. It provides a Business Portal for professionals with client info, quotes, notes, analytics, and a Couples Portal with free digital wedding planning suite, documents, invoices, shared communication, notifications, directory, and reviews.
structured_data.product_service_description: Eternity is a next-gen CRM to manage weddings for professionals and newly engaged couples. It features two main components: 1) Business Portal with client info, quotes, notes, and analytics, and 2) Couples Portal with documents, invoices, shared communication, notifications, directory, and reviews. The platform launched its MVP in October 2024 and has proven product-market fit with paid beta business users.
structured_data.market_size_opportunity: The global wedding and events industry size is $899 billion, with the UK industry size at £15 billion. This compares to other vertical SaaS markets: Beauty ($646bn), Restaurant Reservations ($7.71bn), and Fitness Coaches ($41.8bn).
structured_data.business_model: Eternity has a multi-stream revenue model: 1) Monthly Subscription: £24pm/£240pa + £100 set-up fee per team member paid by solopreneurs & SMEs (wedding decorators, photographers, entertainment, content creators, stationery designers), 2) Service Fees: 1% fees per invoice transaction paid by businesses, 3) Affiliate Payments: 10% commission paid by affiliate partnerships through B2C couple referrals & UTM links, proven to generate £2m+ revenue for trusted platforms.
structured_data.team: The company has a Gen-Z founder, Anshika (anshika@eternity-uk.com), which gives them an advantage in winning trust of businesses faster compared to competitors.
structured_data.traction_milestones: Eternity launched its MVP in October 2024 and has proven product-market fit with 10 paid beta business users (avg. £140pm), 700+ organic couples, and 3 partnerships secured with UK wedding directories. They've grown 90% MoM revenue (£850pm in April 2025). Notable beta stats show average engagement time per active user is 18 minutes, and each business invites an average of 30 couples to Eternity.
structured_data.financials_projections: The company has grown 90% month-over-month in revenue, reaching £850 per month by April 2025. Their 2025 target is 450 B2B paid users and 1,800 B2C active users. By 2026, they aim for 4,600 B2B paid users, 9,900 B2C active users, and £1.3m ARR. Their 2028 target is 28,000 B2B paid users, 56,000 B2C active users, and £10.4m ARR.
structured_data.funding_ask_use_of_funds: Eternity is raising £100k (SEIS & EIS) to: 1) enable payment processing and unlock a new revenue channel, 2) scale customer acquisition & partnerships, and 3) optimize onboarding to accelerate adoption. Their target is to reach 1,000 customers and £70k MRR, providing a 12-month runway.
structured_data.competition: Competitors include Bridebook (sold to The Knot Worldwide for £40m in 2020 at 18.5x multiple), Rock My Wedding (self-funded), Hitched (US unicorn with no UK presence or intention), and Joy (raised F&F round of £157k in 2024, crowdfund of £1m+ in 2023, and US-based with $2.3m and $2m ARR in 2024 with no UK presence or intention). Eternity's competitive advantages include: client-side portal, embedded CRM for vendors, integrated FinTech, two-sided network effects, umbrella approach from lead capture to close, enriched data collection (B2B & B2C), and Gen-Z focus.
structured_data.go_to_market_strategy: Eternity's go-to-market strategy includes partnerships with UK wedding directories. They've already secured 3 partnerships. They plan to expand UK nationwide in 2025, then into wider events (corporates & special occasions), and internationally to English-speaking countries (Australia, UAE, South Africa, India & US) through partnerships by 2026-2027. They're also launching payment processing as a second revenue channel in June 2025 and planning to introduce a B2B CRM mobile app.

founder_profiles.name: Anshika Arora
founder_profiles.background_summary: Anshika Arora is the founder of Eternity, a B2B SaaS CRM aimed at modernizing the wedding industry by providing management, communication, and payment tools for solopreneurs and SMEs. Her founder journey was sparked by a personal experience during the pandemic, giving her a clear and authentic mission. Prior to founding Eternity, she had a brief role as a Relationship Manager at HSBC after graduating with a Business Management degree from the University of Birmingham. Anshika is actively building significant credibility and influence within her niche, recently appointed as a Gen-Z and emerging trends advisor to the UK Wedding Association. Her content on LinkedIn is strategic and focused, clearly articulating the problem Eternity solves and positioning it alongside successful vertical SaaS platforms. She is building a personal brand as a key voice for the future of the wedding industry, particularly in the multicultural and Gen-Z segments.

previous_companies.description: Founded Eternity, a B2B SaaS CRM for the wedding industry, providing management, communication, and payment tools for solopreneurs and SMEs.
Brief role as Relationship Manager prior to founding Eternity.

investment_criteria_assessment.assessment_summary: Anshika Arora is a first-time founder with a strong personal mission and strategic positioning in the wedding industry SaaS space. She has not previously founded a relevant company before Eternity, but demonstrates thought leadership, industry recognition, and a clear understanding of her market. Her background includes a business degree and a brief stint at HSBC, but her main strength is her current founder journey and emerging influence in her sector.

market_analysis.industry_overview: The CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software market comprises platforms and tools that help organizations manage, analyze, and improve their interactions with customers. CRM software centralizes customer data, streamlines sales, marketing, and customer service processes, and provides analytics to enhance customer satisfaction and drive business growth. The market includes cloud-based and on-premise solutions, with increasing adoption across industries such as retail, finance, healthcare, and professional services.
market_analysis.target_market_segment: UK-based businesses of all sizes (SMEs to large enterprises) across sectors such as retail, financial services, healthcare, professional services, and technology, seeking to improve customer engagement, sales processes, and data-driven decision-making.
market_analysis.market_size_tam: Estimated at approximately £2.5 billion in 2024 for the UK CRM software market, based on proportional estimates from global CRM market data.
market_analysis.market_size_sam: Approximately £1.2 billion, representing UK businesses actively seeking CRM solutions with modern features (cloud, AI, integration).
market_analysis.market_size_som: £60-120 million, representing a realistic obtainable share for a new entrant within the first 2-3 years, assuming 5-10% of the SAM.
market_analysis.market_growth_rate_cagr: 11-13% CAGR (2024-2028), in line with global CRM market growth rates and UK digital transformation trends.
key_market_trends: Rapid adoption of cloud-based CRM solutions over on-premise systems.
Integration of AI and automation for predictive analytics, customer insights, and workflow automation.
Increased demand for industry-specific CRM solutions (e.g., healthcare, finance).
Focus on data privacy and compliance with UK/EU regulations (GDPR).
Mobile CRM and remote work driving demand for accessible, user-friendly platforms.
market_analysis.competitor_landscape_summary: The UK CRM software market is highly competitive, with global leaders (Salesforce, Microsoft, HubSpot) and strong local players (Sage, Zoho). Competition is based on product features, integration capabilities, pricing, and customer support. Market share is concentrated among a few large vendors, but there is room for niche and vertical-specific solutions.
